header.title: wxSetCursorEvent

description.p: A wxSetCursorEvent is generated from wxWindow when the mouse cursor is about to be set as a result of mouse motion.

This event gives the application the chance to perform specific mouse cursor processing based on the current position of the mouse within the window. Use setCursor/2 to specify the cursor you want to be displayed.
This class is derived (and can use functions) from: wxEvent

section.title: Events
section.p: Use wxEvtHandler:connect/3 with wxSetCursorEventType to subscribe to events of this type.
